ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: M, W, Fri were virtual classes (per usual). Tuesday, Thursday are take home classes, I.e. assignments + prepare for the next day.
Synchronous sessions with asynchronous days focused on grammar, culture and vocabulary.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned Spanish Grammar, up to topics such as subjunctive if clauses. There were lots of stories and films to watch and analyze.

Developed a facility with analysing literature, films, podcasts in Spanish and really talking about them fluidly (if not fluently). There is still a strong focus on grammar but Prof Baffi prioritised conversation and creativity
Advanced speaking, grammar, and vocabulary skills for fluent spanish.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This course was very well designed for student learning. I enjoyed the 3 live lectures a week plus 2 asynchronous lectures.

Organization on Canvas needs a little help - where are the modules, assignments, which HW is optional/ mandatory/ counts for participation/ separate from it, due when etc  there was some confusion around these logistical aspects.

But the course content itself, the instruction, the assignments themselves, Prof Baffi  all really great!
Workload could get a little repetitive at times, but the variety of modes in which we did work was acceptable and kept the class somewhat engaging.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I enjoyed the seminar format of the class. It was a great way to practice Spanish and get to know my peers.

Offline Tuesday/ Thursday didnt really work well since we were supposed to block those times out on our calendars anyway for SPAN 140 quizzes/ exams scheduled for those days.  Just added to the confusion imo with the same amount of workload (just re-packaged as HW assignments).

Everything excellent besides that
The transition to having asynchronous days interspersed made the class more manageable compared to the traditional everyday synchronous meetings.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: For sure. Many of the short films and readings were pretty funny, so class discussions were fun. The historical and cultural pieces were also super interesting and informative. Definitely opt for Profesora Baffi if you can! She's is one of the sweetest people on the planet, and I feel like her kindness helped us all feel more comfortable challenging ourselves at the risk of making mistakes. Learning a whole new language can get frustrating at times, but when you're met with patience, understanding, and support, a lot of the frustration dissipates.
Yes. This course is well designed to facilitate student learning and I really enjoyed the seminar format online.
Yes, and Prof Baffi is great
If they want to be fluent in spanish at the end of the sequence this is a must take class.
